qas.question: Which chromosome is responsible for produlcing male differentiation on defect female development?
What is the differentiation process driven by?
What results in sexual differences in males and females?

answers.text: secretion of androgens, that will cooperate in driving the sexual differentiation of the developing fetus, included its brain

qas.question: What have scientist began to test due to the fact that adrogen results in sexual differences?

answers.text: the result of modifying androgen exposure levels in mammals during fetus and early life

context: As female fetuses have two X chromosomes and male ones a XY pair, the <a0_0>chromosome Y<a0_0/> is the responsible for producing male differentiation on the defect female development. The differentiation process is driven by <a1_0>androgen hormones,<a1_0/> mainly testosterone and dihydrotestosterone (DHT). The newly formed testicles in the fetus are responsible for the <a2_0>secretion of androgens, that will cooperate in driving the sexual differentiation of the developing fetus, included its brain<a2_0/>. This results in sexual differences between males and females. This fact has led some scientists to test in various ways <a3_0>the result of modifying androgen exposure levels in mammals during fetus and early life<a3_0/>.
